title: Top 10 Most Anticipated Fantasy Games in 2015 / 2016

json.text: Welcome to the skilled channel. And today we're talking about upcoming games that implement
elements of fantasy in one way or another. They may involve supernatural elements or
imaginary worlds, but they are all focused on fun and immersion. So let's take a look
at the top 10 most anticipated fantasy games.
10 Fable Legends � PC, XB1 / TBA Fable Legends focuses on co-operative RPG
gameplay. Four heroes will face off against one villain online. Each hero has unique abilities,
powers, and techniques. But ultimately the villains control how the quests playout. The
game is based around five players: four heroes, and a villain. The AI controls the characters
in the absence of a human player. But the villain player controls the nature of the
quest the hero characters play, such as where enemies will spawn, how aggressive they are,
when the boss will attack, and when to lay traps. The villain earns points over time,
which can be spent on units for an even bigger army of evil foes.
Unlike other games in the series,�Fable Legends�is essentially a dungeon crawler
and is very different from the previous games. The player can customize their hero's weapons,
looks, armor, abilities and more. Like many other games in the franchise, heroes can also
use expressions to interact with villagers.�In the hub-city of�Brightlodge,�players have
the opportunity to partake in jobs, play mini-games and enjoy pub games. Once the player selects
a quest, they are immediately sent out into the world. The game is intended to have a
5-10 year life-cycle, and will be integrated into the cloud features of the Xbox One. Fable
Legends release date is still to be announced, but it will be releasing for PC and Xbox One.
09 Tales Of Symphonia HD � PC / TBA 2016 Tales of Symphonia returns in HD on the PC
platform with modernized graphics. Like previous installments in the�Tales�series,�Tales
of Symphonia�consists primarily of three major areas: an�overworld�field map, town
and dungeon maps, and a battle screen. The overworld map is a 3D model, featuring a scaled-down
version of the game's fictional world which the player travels through to reach the game's
locations.
The story begins with Lloyd Irving�and his friend,�Genis Sage�accompanying the chosen,�Colette
Brunel and her guardians,�Raine Sage�and�Kratos Aurion�on her journey of world regeneration.
The purpose of the journey is to replenish Sylvarant with mana, a necessary energy to
their survival. The path of the journey consists of five temples which must be unsealed by
Colette. During battle sequences, the game uses the
Multi-Line Linear Motion Battle System. Four characters from the�party�are chosen to
battle. Damage dealt to the opponent fills a "Unison Gauge". When this is full, a "Unison
Attack" can be triggered, allowing the party to use techniques simultaneously on a single
enemy. Tales of Symphonia HD launches on PC Steam in 2016.
8 Battleborn � PC, PS4, XB1 / Feb 9, 2016 Battleborn is Gearbox's multiplayer shooter
that's kind of like a first person shooter moba hybrid. Think of Borderlands, but in
a big team based versus mode. It is multiplayer focused but it will have a story mode that
can be played alone or cooperatively. The story mode can be played with up to five people
online or in splitscreen. It will be modular which means players can replay certain missions
for a chance to get better loot. For the loot hunters, there will be plenty of gear to hunt
for. Chasing after better gear is the most addicting part of these games. The setting
of Battleborn is essentially about the last survivors of the sentient races in the universe,
fighting it out for the last star to save the universe.
The multiplayer mode will be 5 on 5 so this isn't huge scale multiplayer like Battlefield
but it's perfect for Gearbox's type of shooter. That means each individual player's contributions
count a lot more. There will be 25 unique characters to choose from and a detailed progression
system for those characters. Battleborn releases on February 9th, 2016 for PC, PS4, and Xbox
One.
7 Yooka Laylee � TBA 2016 Yooka Laylee is another 3D platfomer that
is planned for release in October of 2016. It is not only inspired by the late 90s 3D
platformers, but it is actually being developed by ex-Rare members�the very same people
who worked on the Banjo Kazooie series. In this game, Yooka the chameleon and Laylee
the bat have to team up and use many abilities and transformations so that they can traverse
through the various worlds locked away inside magical books. They do this by collecting
golden items called Pagies that are strewn throughout the worlds. Playtonic Games, the
developer behind this nostalgic tribute, raised their funding goal in just 28 minutes on Kickstarter.
The game has since gone on to raise over 2 million pounds, which makes Yooka Laylee the
highest-funded UK game in Kickstarter history. Fans are definitely excited for this game.
Yooka Laylee's release date is still to be announced, but they are hoping to launch some
time in 2016.
6 Star Ocean: Integrity and Faithlessness � PS4 / TBA 2016
Star Ocean: Integrity and Faithlessnes is the fifth game in this epic RPG fantasy series
published by Square Enix. The game occurs in Space Date 537, set between Star Ocean:
The Second Story and Star Ocean: Till the End of Time. So this is centuries after humanity
has spread out from Earth. After many trials and the spread of the Galactic Federation,
humanity is finally on the verge of peace. However, on the planet of Faycreed, problems
have begun to arise.
The battle system is similar to other games in the Star Ocean series, with the player
controlling a character in one-on-one battles, with the ability to switch control of characters.
Boss battles will feature the entire party facing off against a boss. The real-time action
battle system features improved game mechanics. Battles will take place directly on the overworld
field instead of a separate location. This time around cutscenes are intended to transition
seamlessly with gameplay.
Star Ocean releases on the PS3 and PS4 on February 25, 2016 in Japan and the North American
PS4 release date is still To Be Announced.
5 Plants Vs Zombies Garden Warfare 2 � PC, PS4, Xbox One / 2016
Plants vs Zombies Garden Warfare 2 is the sequel to the fun multiplayer fantasy shooter.
In Garden Warfare 2, the Zombies have finally won the battle and now they have to defend
Zomburbia from the plants who are trying to reclaim it.
Players who unlocked characters in the first game will have their characters in the sequel
already unlocked. In addition there are 6 new classes with over 100 playable characters
total and 12 new maps.
Many of the new classes offer unique features. The imp class is an agile dual wielding zombie.
He jumps in and out battle and deal heavy damage with his imp kata ability. Citron is
a bounty hunting orange from the future who helps the plants. He can transform into a
ball and launch into enemies. Super Brainz is a zombie character with a super hero like
appearance and he's the first melee oriented character. You'll get to play as these classes
and more in Garden Warfare 2 when it launches on Xbox One, PS4, and PC in 2016.
4 Ratchet And Clank � PS4 / June 30, 2016 Ratchet and Clank is shaping up to be a beautiful
re-imagining of the original game that released in 2002. This will mark the first Ratchet
and Clank movie release and it will be one of the biggest movie and game tie ins if they
are both successful.
One of the most exciting parts of Ratchet and Clank was landing on different planets
and exploring all of them. And the movement sections return grinding on rail systems and
hoverboards. We also see that they are using team based moves as Clank helps Ratchet by
transforming into a platform.
The Hud has been completely revamped and the scroll wheel weapon selection system is still
there so we can expect the same high variety of weapons. And just like the previous games,
it's a mix of dangerous explosives and other weapons that just straight up cause mischief
and mayhem. There's new explosive weapons, pyro flame throwers, and even the groovetron
which makes enemies dance. There's also a gun that pixelizes and slows the enemies.
The character modeling and animation looks like it's received the best treatment. The
way enemies move and appear on screen is so fluid. Even the city in the background looks
really filled out and detailed. There's so much clarity even with buildings and architecture
being far away. The game is just an amazing adventure for fans of all ages. Ratchet and
Clank releases June 30th only on the PS4.
3 Kingdom Hearts 3 � PS4, Xbox One / 2016 It�s been nearly ten years since we last
saw a Kingdom Hearts title, and now that Kingdom Hearts III has finally been announced, fans
are beside themselves with anticipation. The series expertly combines the timeless magic
of Disney with the fantastical sense of adventure of Square�s award-winning Final Fantasy
series in a truly unique action-adventure experience. The story takes place after the
events of Kingdom Hearts: Dream Drop Distance. It features an older Sora as the main protagonist
who sets forth on a new adventure with Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, Goofy, and more Disney
characters in search of seven guardians of light and the key to Return Hearts to stop
Master Xehanort's devious plan. Kingdom Hearts 3 releases on the PS4 and Xbox One in 2016.
2 Scalebound � Xbox One / TBA 2016 Drew has been thrown into the magical world
of Draconis from our modern world. He sports headphones, jeans, and a black leather jacket,
a realistic look to contrast with the fantastical setting of Draconis. Drew looks like your
average guy but he has a dragon arm that allows him to connect with a dragon companion and
also perform supernatural attacks. Drew is bonded to Thuban, a massive dragon who is
the last of his kind. The binding means that the two characters share the same life stream,
if one dies, the other dies as well.
Drew mostly participates in combat from afar, firing explosive arrows at enemies and providing
Thuban with direction. There also throwable mines that can attach to enemies and detonate
when hit with a flaming arrow or Thuban's fire breath. On a smaller note, Drew's headphones
provide a cool added feature to the game by playing fast-paced dance music during combat.
In addition to normal attacks, Drew sports a dragon arm that allows him to heal Thuban,
attack with pulse energy, and scan enemies. Drew also collects energy from defeating enemies
that culminates in an overdrive-like attack, transforming him into a powerful half-dragon
for a short time. The intense strength of the dragon form rewards players for defeating
enemies by allowing them to mow down even more enemies with ease. When an enemy that
contains Pulse energy is killed, it drops red Pulse gems that Drew can use to upgrade
his equipment and Thuban himself.
At its core, Scalebound is still an RPG, so customization is a big feature. Players can
customize their own Thuban by selecting different body parts or colors. These modifications
will have an effect on how Thuban fights. If Thuban is made lighter with a bladed tail,
he will be more useful as an offensive weapon. If the player wants to do more of the fighting
with his or her own sword, a larger Thuban that can be used as a diversion and a damage-sponge
might be useful. The story of Scalebound will mainly focus on Drew, so while he can level
up considerably, he is not customizable. Scalebound releases some time in 2016 only
on Xbox One.
1 Final Fantasy XV � PS4, XB1 / TBA 2016 Final Fantasy is one of the longest running
RPG series and the fifteenth installment is bringing a lot of new gameplay elements. The
game takes place in a world similar to modern-day Earth. It has typical RPG gameplay but with
third-person action elements. The characters have the ability to traverse the environment
in a free-running style, which also extends to battle with larger enemies. The world is
a large connected landmass which can be explored on foot or by using a car or a chocobo. The
new camping system provides players a new way to level up their characters. Experience
points earned in battle during the day are converted into new levels during evening camping
periods. Final Fantasy XV is taking a huge leap forward and should hopefully reunite
fans of the series. The game releases on PS4 and Xbox One in 2016.
The fantasy genre reaches from RPG to adventure and action. There's such a wide variety of
games coming out that stretch the imagination and offer an experience that you can get lost
in. What are your favorite games from this list? Or did we miss any good ones? Let us
know in the comments and subscribe to the skilled channel for more fun upcoming games
previews.
